instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-0165: What is 820-0165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> working but no Magsafe light
threads.message: something very strange, I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that is working but there is no magsafe light. Has anyone ran into this issue before? I tried to search the forum to no avail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> working but no Magsafe light
threads.message: Nevermind, tried a different DC IN Board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> working but no Magsafe light
threads.message: Do you mean was just a bad DCIN board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> working but no Magsafe light
threads.message: Yes in this case I had a bad DCIN board I was using. This board did have problems but I restored PP3V42. I have a bunch of DCIN boards so I must have grabbed one that is not working. Do you know if there is something on the DCIN board that would keep the green light from coming on even though you have PP3V42?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> working but no Magsafe light
threads.message:
DCIN board has few components on <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> line.
There should be a 0 ohm resistor, or a small coil.

And of course a TVS diode, which is the common fail.
It will burn serie mentioned resistor/coil too...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> working but no Magsafe light
threads.message: Is it worth repairing? I mean the DCIN board works, just no green light.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> working but no Magsafe light
threads.message:
Why not, for few cents only?
You can probably find 10 min one day to fix it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> working but no Magsafe light
threads.message: Ok, I will try my hand at that
